page.title: 10BISHOPS VILLAGE NEWS cont'd
page.content: that they would ask for advertisement to cover the cost of producing the magazine, if possible. The{Parish {Council}initially helped with finances i.e. buying paper, stencils, typewriter etc. At first they used a duplicator at the{Southam}Council office. After a short period they decided to have a house-to-house collection to raise money to buy their own duplicator.{ "Scene"}came into operation in{1979}and to raise some money towards the initial costs a very successful cookery book was produced using recipes collected from the village itself. The "Scene" village magazine is still going strong in{1985.}
